text: Use "ã€œã§ã™/ã€œã¾ã™" for polite statements; it's the standard polite ending for everyday conversation.
"ã€œã¾ã›ã‚“" is the polite negative form of verbs, used to say something doesn't happen.
"ã€œãŸã„" attaches to a verb stem to express "want to do" something.
"ã€œã¦ã‚‚ã„ã„ã§ã™" means "it's okay to" and grants permission.
"ã€œã¦ã¯ã„ã‘ã¾ã›ã‚“" means "must not" and is used for prohibitions.
"ã€œãªãŒã‚‰" connects actions to show two things happening at the same time.
"ã€œãŸã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚‹" expresses past experience, like "have done" something before.
"ã€œã¦ã—ã¾ã†" can show completion or regret about an action.
"ã€œãã†ã§ã™" can report hearsay ("I heard that...").
"ã€œã‚ˆã†ã§ã™" means "it seems like" and is based on observation.
"ã€œã§ã—ã‚‡ã†" adds probability or softens statements, like "probably".
"ã€œã¤ã‚‚ã‚Š" expresses intent, like "I plan to" do something.
"ã€œãªã‘ã‚Œã°ãªã‚‰ãªã„" means "must" or "have to" do something.
"ã€œãªãã¦ã‚‚ã„ã„" means "don't have to" and lifts an obligation.
"ã€œã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹" indicates someone does a favor for the speaker.
"ã€œã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†" means "receive a favor" from someone.
"ã€œã¦ã‚ã’ã‚‹" shows the speaker does a favor for someone else.
"ã€œã‚ˆã†ã¨æ€ã†" expresses a decision made at the moment of speaking.
"ã€œãªã‚‰" means "if" or "in the case of" and often gives advice.
"ã€œãŸã‚‰" is a conditional "if/when" that also expresses sequence.
"ã€œã°" forms a conditional meaning "if" in a general sense.
"ã€œã¦ã‚‚" means "even if" or "even though".
"ã€œã®ã«" expresses contrast or regret, similar to "even though".
"ã€œã®ã§" gives a reason in a polite or softer way than "ã‹ã‚‰".
"ã€œãŸã¨ã“ã‚" can mean "just did" something and observed a result.
"ã€œã¾ã¾" means "as is" or "unchanged".
"ã€œã°ã‹ã‚Š" means "just" (in terms of time) or "only" depending on context.
"ã€œã™ãŽã‚‹" attaches to verbs or adjectives to mean "too much".
"ã€œã‚‰ã—ã„" can mean "seems" or describe a typical characteristic.
"ã€œãŠã†/ã€œã‚ˆã†" is the volitional form, used to say "let's" or "I will".
"ã€œã¨ã“ã‚" refers to a point in time, like "about to", "in the middle of", or "just finished".
"ã€œãŸã‚Šã€œãŸã‚Š" lists representative actions, like "do things like A and B".
"ã€œã¦ã„ã/ã€œã¦ãã‚‹" shows direction or change over time, like "will start" or "have been".
"ã€œã‚ˆã†ã«" can express purpose, like "in order to" or "so that".
"ã€œãŸã‚ã«" also means "for the sake of" and explains purpose or reason.
"ã€œã“ã¨ã«ã™ã‚‹" expresses a decision, like "decide to".
"ã€œã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚‹" indicates something was decided (by others or circumstances).
"ã€œã«é•ã„ãªã„" means "must be" or "no doubt".
"ã€œã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œãªã„" means "might be" or "maybe".
"ã€œã†ã¡ã«" means "while" or "before" something changes.
"ã€œã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹" expresses ability, like "can do".
"ã€œã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‚‹" means "sometimes" when talking about habitual actions.
"ã€œã«ãã„" attaches to verb stems to mean "hard to do".
"ã€œã‚„ã™ã„" attaches to verb stems to mean "easy to do".
"ã€œã¦ãŠã" means "do in advance" or "leave as is".
"ã€œã«ã™ã‚‹" means "decide on" a choice or selection.
"ã€œã«æ±ºã¾ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹" means "must be" or "definitely".
"ã€œãã†ã " can indicate appearance, like "it looks like".
"ã€œãªãŒã‚‰ã‚‚" means "even while" or "though" (contrast).
"ã€œã‚ã‘ã§ã¯ãªã„" means "not necessarily" or "it's not that".
"ã€œã¨ã„ã†ã‚ˆã‚Š" means "rather than" or "more like".
"ã€œãŠã‹ã’ã§" expresses gratitude for a cause, "thanks to".
"ã€œã›ã„ã§" indicates a negative cause, "because of".
"ã€œã»ã©" can express degree, like "so... that".
"ã€œã°ã€œã»ã©" means "the more... the more...".
"ã€œã«é•ã„ãªã„" expresses strong conviction: "must be".
"ã€œã‚ã‘ãŒãªã„" means "there is no way that...".
"ã€œã‚ˆã†ã«ã™ã‚‹" means "make an effort to...".
"ã€œã¦ã—ã¾ã†" can express completion or regret ("end up doing").
"ã€œã«ã—ã¦ã¯" means "considering...".
"ã€œã«ã¨ã£ã¦" means "for / to (someone)".
"ã€œã«ã¤ã‚Œã¦" means "as... changes, ... also changes".
"ã€œã«æ¯”ã¹ã¦" means "compared to...".
"ã€œã«ã‚ˆã‚‹ã¨" means "according to...".
"ã€œã«å¿œã˜ã¦" means "depending on...".
"ã€œã«åŠ ãˆã¦" means "in addition to...".
"ã€œã«å‘ã‘ã¦" means "toward / in preparation for".

"ã€œã‚‚ã®ã®" means "although..." with contrast.
"ã€œã¾ã¾" means "as-is / while remaining...".
"ã€œã‚ã‘ã«ã¯ã„ã‹ãªã„" means "cannot (due to circumstances)".
"ã€œã¦ä»¥æ¥" means "since (doing)".

"ã€œã¨ã“ã‚" can mean "just did / about to do / in the middle of".
"ã€œã“ã¨ã«ã™ã‚‹" means "decide to...".
"ã€œã“ã¨ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹" means "it is decided/arranged that...".
"ã€œã‚ã‚Šã«" means "despite / considering...".
"ã€œãªãŒã‚‰" can mean "while" (simultaneous action).
"ã€œã«ã™ãŽãªã„" means "no more than...".
"ã€œã¦ã¯ã˜ã‚ã¦" means "only after...".
"ã€œã«æ°—ã¥ã" means "to notice / realize...".
"ã€œã°ã‹ã‚Šã‹" means "not only... but also".
"ã€œã«ã—ãŸãŒã£ã¦" means "as / in accordance with...".
